questions.text: How much of a tip did Carla's customer give at first?
questions.explanation:
$0.25

	Carla started to comment about how she could now pay for surgery. He then pulled out a $10 bill and said he didn't have change. Carla gave him change - the 25 cents he gave her originally.

Norm's.

	Norm was afraid he'd be fired when he saw his boss coming so he hid in the bathroom. His boss gave him a choice of being fired, or being the executive executioner, that is the person who fires other people.

questions.text: What happened when Norm fired his first person?
questions.explanation:
Norm cried.

	Norm found out the man had a family and was so grateful for the job he had. When Norm finally told him (it took all day), Norm started to cry.

questions.text: Who did Norm have to fire?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Peabody

	Norm found out he was going to be getting a new office, which belonged to Mr. Peabody. When Norm asked if the office belonged to Mr. Peabody he was told that it wouldn't once Norm fired him.

questions.text: Who was Cliff having trouble with?
questions.explanation:
his neighbor.

	Cliff didn't like the fact that his neighbor always had junk all over his yard. Carla wrote a nasty letter to the neighbor on behalf of Cliff, had Cliff sign it and then put it in the mail. The problem with the neighbor was solved and Cliff had to get the letter back from the mailman before it was mailed.

questions.text: Who was another man that Norm fired?
questions.explanation:
Parker.

	Parker was played by Warren Munson. Munson's career started in 1966 when he played the Emcee on an episode of "The Farmer's Daughter".

questions.text: Who was the mailman for Cheers?
questions.explanation:
Twitchel.

	Walt Twitchel was played by Raye Birk. Despite Twitchel's love of the post cffice, he and Cliff did not get along.

Norm.

	Norm dreamed that he was sending people down to Hell. Then a man with his head covered approached him, and when he took the cover off it turned out Norm was seeing himself.

questions.text: What did Sam ask Diane to do?
questions.explanation:
wipe up the bar sweat.

	Diane had just told Norm that doing a job that was demeaning had to be hard and she could understand why he was having nightmares. Sam then asked her to clean up the bar sweat and she sighed, realizing she was doing a demeaning job herself.

questions.text: Why didn't Norm cry when he fired John?
options: His boss yelled at him for crying so much.
questions.explanation:
He had run dry.

	John was offended when Norm didn't cry. Norm tried to cry but it was fake, which infuriated John even more.
